verses.text: Strive not with a mighty man, Lest thou fall into his hands.
Be not at variance with a rich man, lest he overweigh thee: For gold hath destroyed many, And perverted the hearts of kings.
Strive not with a man that is full of tongue, And heap not wood upon his fire.
Jest not with a rude \add man\add*, Lest thy ancestors be disgraced.
Reproach not a man that turneth from sin, \add But\add* remember that we are all worthy of punishment.
Dishonour not a man in his old age: For even \add some\add* of us wax old.
Rejoice not over thy greatest enemy being dead, \add But\add* remember that we die all.
Despise not the discourse of the wise, But acquaint thyself with their proverbs: For of them thou shalt learn instruction, And \add how\add* to serve great men with ease.
Miss not the discourse of the elders: For they also learned of their fathers, And of them thou shalt learn understanding, And to give answer as need requireth.
Kindle not the coals of a sinner, Lest thou be burnt with the flame of his fire.
Rise not up \add in anger\add* at the presence of an injurious person, Lest he lie in wait to entrap thee in thy words.
Lend not unto him \add that is\add* mightier than thyself; For if thou lendest \add him\add*, count \add it\add* but lost.
Be not surety above thy power: For if thou be surety, take care to pay \add it\add*.
Go not to law with a judge; For they will judge for him according to his honour.
Travel not by the way with a bold \add fellow\add*, Lest he become grievous unto thee: For he will do according to his own will, And thou shalt perish with \add him\add* through his folly.
Strive not with an angry \add man\add*, And go not with him into a solitary place: For blood \add is\add* as nothing in his sight; And where there is no help, he will overthrow thee.
Consult not with a fool; For he cannot keep counsel.
Do no secret \add thing\add* before a stranger; For thou knowest not what he will bring forth.
Open not thine heart to every man, Lest he requite thee with a shrewd turn.
